maxaifeaturization.aggregation package

Submodules

maxaifeaturization.aggregation.aggregation module

class maxaifeaturization.aggregation.aggregation.Aggregation(df, arguments)[source]

Bases: object

Performs aggregation operations on the passed DataFrame

Parameters

  • df (spark.DataFrame) – DataFrame on which operations are to be performed

  • arguments (dict) –

    list of dictionaries containing aggregation, feature_name, output_column_name keys. - aggregation (int): aggregation operation (sum, average, etc) to be performed. List of operations available: ``` {

    1: “sum”, 2: “mean”, 3: “stddev”, 4: “max”, 5: “min”, 6: “count”, 7: “count_distinct”, 8: “variance”, 9: “percentile”, 10: “quantile”, 11: “median”, 12: “most_frequent”

    • feature (list): Name of feature on which aggregation is to performed. Accepts only one input

    • output_column_name (list): Name of the output column generated post aggregation

— Example: ``` from maxaifeaturization.aggregation import Aggregation

df = spark.read.csv(filepath) # file on which aggregations are to performed agg_dict = {

“entity_column”: “customer_id”, “aggregation_ops”: [

{

“aggregation”: 2, “feature”: [“total_revenue”], “output_column_name”: [“mean_rev”]

}, {

“aggregation”: 4, “feature”: [“total_revenue”], “output_column_name”: [“max_rev”]

},

]

}

agg_obj = Aggregation(df=df, arguments=agg_dict) agg_df = agg_obj.execute() ```

execute()[source]

driver method

Returns

spark.DataFrame
